alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Wayne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 4:56PM EDT until July 27 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lackawanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Luzerne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southern Wyoming County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 456 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Millrift to near Hawley to near Scranton to Ricketts Glen State Park, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Falls, Muhlenberg, Dunmore, Kingston, Nanticoke, Plains, Old Forge and Pittston. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
